title: Rivian Automotive Seeks IPO Valuation Above $60 Billion
summary: Amazon-backed electric-vehicle startup plans for IPO next week on Nasdaq. Rivian Automotive Inc. is seeking a valuation in a range just above $60 billion in its initial public offering next week, one of the biggest and most-anticipated deals yet in a blockbuster year for new issues.

title: Amazon Says Fully Vaccinated Workers Can Skip Face Masks
summary: Warehouse employees with proof of Covid-19 vaccination can go maskless starting Nov. 2. Amazon.com Inc. is relaxing its mask-wearing rules for U.S. employees, letting those who are fully vaccinated against Covid-19 work in its warehouses without a face covering.

title: Robert Durst Indicted on Murder Charge in First Wife's Death
summary: Kathie Durst disappeared in 1982; Her body was never found. NEW YORK (AP)-Millionaire real estate scion Robert Durst was indicted Monday on a murder charge in the death of his first wife, Kathie Durst, who disappeared nearly four decades ago, prosecutors said.

title: Tech Companies Push Two-Factor Authentication
summary: Inertia and ignorance have slowed the voluntary adoption of an online security tool. Some companies have begun mandating it in response.. Google has spent the better part of 10 years persuading users to add an extra layer of security verification to their accounts. Now, it's done asking nicely.

title: Manchin Nails the Progressive Hostage Strategy
summary: Biden has double-crossed Senate Republicans on the infrastructure bill by caving to the left.. Democrats want to vote this week on a pair of epic tax and spending bills, yet they're still playing hide-the-ball on their multi-trillion-dollar reconciliation bill. It's clearer than ever that the Democrats and Republicans who want to vote for the $1 trillion Senate infrastructure bill are being taken for a ride.

title: School Choice Showdown in Michigan
summary: Gov. Whitmer stands in the schoolhouse door against options for parents.. This has been a banner year for school choice across much of the U.S., and Michigan is the latest state to advance the cause. The GOP-led Legislature last week passed choice legislation that will force Democratic Gov. Gretchen Whitmer to choose between students and teachers unions.

title: At COP26, Biden Calls for More Action on Climate as Divides Widen
summary: As U.S. president says the coming decade will be decisive, India gives slower-than-expected deadline for slashing its carbon emissions. GLASGOW-President Biden told world leaders at the COP26 summit here that the coming decade would be decisive in the fight against climate change.

title: A Biden Trade Win in Europe
summary: Rolling back some Trump-era tariffs is good for both sides.. Good news for free trade is all too rare these days, so it was a relief to have some over the weekend. President Biden and his European Union counterparts made important progress in putting to bed one of the more foolhardy legacies of the Trump era, a trade war over tariffs on European steel and aluminum.

title: A Lobster Lesson in Geopolitics
summary: Hong Kong is caught in the middle of a China-Australia trade spat.. China is using coercive trade policy to cow Australia into political silence, and now it is trying to dragoon Hong Kong to violate its trade principles in the bargain. Behold the tale of Australian lobster.

title: The Challenge of Being Human in the Age of AI
summary: Reason is our primary means of understanding the world. How does that change if machines think?. The White House Office of Science and Technology Policy has called for "a bill of rights" to protect Americans in what is becoming "an AI-powered world." The concerns about AI are well-known and well-founded: that it will violate privacy and compromise transparency, and that biased input data will yield biased outcomes, including in fields essential to individual and societal flourishing such as medicine, law enforcement, hiring and loans.

title: Worker Shortage Could Bring Back Stagflation
summary: We can't achieve strong economic growth without substantial expansion of the labor force.. I helped start an Oshkosh, Wis.-based plastics manufacturing business. It was 1979, in the midst of stagflation. Because inflation was endemic, we didn't think much about it. Like everyone else, we simply dealt with it. Price increases were expected and accepted throughout the economy.

title: 'Peace' Groups Hate the Abraham Accords
summary: The more Arab-Israeli ties produce good results, the more people will reject Iran's malign influence. .. Israel's Foreign Minister Yair Lapid flew to Manama, Bahrain, in September to open the new Israeli Embassy, where he stated, "May our people live in peace and prosperity forever." The ceremony was proof that last year's Abraham Accords continue to foster peace and prosperity.

title: The U.S. and EU Shake Up Global Trade
summary: The G-20 was another yawner, but big news unfolded alongside the summit in Rome.. The Group of 20 summit in Rome last weekend was highly unusual. Unlike most global gabfests, it actually mattered-not because the sterile G-20 format and the anodyne communiqués it predictably generated meant or accomplished anything of significance. It mattered because the U.S. and the European Union, sidestepping the G-20 process, unveiled a tentative trade agreement that significantly sharpens the competition with China, and because five G-20 heads of government (China, Japan, Mexico, Russia and South Africa) were absent, highlighting the declining importance of these ritualized displays of international comity.

title: Terry McAuliffe's Panic Attacks
summary: Polls in the Virginia governor's race now give the GOP's Glenn Youngkin the edge.. Throughout his run for Virginia governor, Terry McAuliffe has stayed on message. This means campaigning against Donald Trump instead of the Republican on the ballot, Glenn Youngkin. Mr. McAuliffe stuck faithfully to script-until Saturday, when out of nowhere he told CNN's Dana Bash: "This is not about Trump."

title: 'Fuzz' Review: Rebellious Nature
summary: A high-concept, unruly, utterly fascinating look at our attempts to control the wild world around us-and when those plans go awry.. For the past three years, a gray squirrel has set out to ruin my life, chewing leaves off my beloved exotic hibiscus and geraniums. What squirrel eats leaves? This one. In a steadily escalating campaign, she has checkmated every move I've made. She's climbed a high deck, vaulted into pots on pedestals and hurled herself into baskets hung five feet above ground. Two live traps ignored. My dog, who is no slouch, has done his best. The squirrel watches and waits until my dog is indoors and I have driven off. Each time I come home, there's another sad pile of bits where once there were blossoms. Still, Mary Roach's "Fuzz: When Nature Breaks the Law" makes me feel grateful that my nemesis is only a rodent, and that I live in Ohio, not Colorado or India. My refrigerator will not be emptied by a bear; I will not be throttled by a leopard while taking out the compost.

title: Coke to Pay $5.6 Billion for Full Control of BodyArmor
summary: Gatorade rival, backed by athletes, on track for $1.4 billion in retail sales this year. Coca-Cola Co. is buying full control of BodyArmor for $5.6 billion in a cash deal that values the sports-drink brand at about $8 billion, amping up a rivalry with Gatorade.

title: Hurricane Forecasters Run Out of Names for Atlantic Storms
summary: Only third time National Hurricane Center has used all 21 names before season ends. There have been so many storms in the Atlantic Ocean this year that the National Hurricane Center has used up all 21 available names, the third time in recorded history that has happened.

title: Mortgage Bond Sales Surged in October
summary: Non-agency deals and credit-risk transfer bonds push issuance to near record levels. Mortgage companies in the U.S. issued $21 billion of mortgage-backed bonds in October, the second heaviest month of borrowing since the 2008-09 financial crisis, according to research by Bank of America Corp.

title: Supreme Court Questions Texas Abortion Law
summary: Justices voice concern about state's efforts to shield its stringent restrictions on abortions from judicial scrutiny. WASHINGTON-Supreme Court justices asked skeptical questions Monday about a novel Texas ban on many abortions, voicing concern about the state's efforts to shield its stringent restrictions from judicial scrutiny.

title: 'Equals' by Ed Sheeran Review: Emotions by the Numbers
summary: The singer-songwriter's latest album sounds a lot like his past work and tells listeners exactly how they should feel.. The staggering success of English singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran is so difficult to comprehend one can only recite statistics: He has the most popular song of all time on Spotify-"Shape of You" is closing in on three billion streams-and he had the highest-grossing tour in music history, pulling in $775 million from nearly nine million paying customers in the string of concerts that came to a close in 2018. That massive single and tour were connected to "Divide," the top-selling album of 2017, which won Best Pop Vocal Album at the Grammys. The tendency to think of Mr. Sheeran's music, which is powered by his acoustic guitar strumming and his flexible tenor, in terms of figures on a balance sheet is helped along by the fact that his solo records are titled with mathematical symbols. "Divide" has the two dots and horizontal line we use for division, and his previous LPs, 2011's "Plus" and 2014's "Multiply," both feature the associated operators. The flurry of record-setting data surrounding his work makes you want to reach for a calculator in order to get a handle on it.

title: Get Ready for Government-Approved Child Care
summary: Who wants to put bureaucracies in charge of kids even before they get to kindergarten?. President Joe Bidenappeared to fall asleep on Monday at an international gathering to discuss the climate issue he describes as an existential threat to the world. But back in the U.S. the remaining so-called moderate Democrats in Congress are the ones who seem to be asleep as they prepare to vote for an existential threat to private preschools and day care.

title: American Airlines Cancels Hundreds of More Flights
summary: The carrier's Monday and weekend troubles follow similar turmoil at rivals Spirit and Southwest. American Airlines Group Inc . canceled hundreds of additional flights on Monday, facing more of the trouble that began during the weekend as it struggles to meet growing travel demand with a staff reduced in size because of the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Feeling Jazz, on Film and Video
summary: Performance footage reveals the music's emotional and physical power..

title: Dow Briefly Jumps Above 36000, Finishes at Record
summary: S&P 500 and Nasdaq also hit highs as corporate earnings fuel optimism about economic recovery. U.S. stocks continued a weekslong march higher, reaching new records on Monday in a display of investor confidence in the economy's bumpy recovery.

title: Supreme Court Won't Review Intelligence Court's Keeping Post-9/11 Rulings Secret
summary: Justices decline to hear case calling for release of redacted decisions authorizing surveillance after terrorist attacks. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court on Monday declined to review a federal foreign-intelligence court's decision to keep secret its opinions authorizing the expansion of surveillance following the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks.

title: U.S. Targets Stablecoin Digital Currency for Banklike Oversight
summary: A Treasury-led panel asked Congress to set up a regulatory framework to address growing risks. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration on Monday took the first significant step to impose banklike oversight on the cryptocurrency companies involved in the issuance of stablecoins, outlining a process that could shape the future of that digital money.

summary: Measures for private-sector businesses and federal contractors take shape-both in the face of lawsuits. The Biden administration is moving ahead with mandates that workers at private-sector businesses be vaccinated against Covid-19, giving companies more details on implementation and setting the issue up for further legal challenges.

title: COP26 Summit: Climate Change's Real Risks
summary: Resume Subscription. Looking at much of the media reporting ahead of this week's climate conference in Glasgow, you'd think the world was subject to biblical plagues-blasted by fires, floods, hurricanes, drought and disease. But as Bjorn Lomborg has explained recently in these pages, while global warming does pose problems, it is hardly the unmitigated disaster often portrayed. At times, the solutions activists propose can be far worse than what they're trying to prevent.

title: Global Covid-19 Death Toll Tops 5 Million
summary: U.S. has highest number of total confirmed deaths, followed by Brazil, India and Mexico, according to Johns Hopkins data. The reported global Covid-19 death toll surpassed five million Monday, according to data compiled by Johns Hopkins University.

title: Dining on the Campaign Trail (Tuesday Crossword, November 2)
VMware's Solo Act Should Sing
summary: Completion of its spinoff from Dell should help the software maker shed its conglomerate discount. After more than 14 years on the public market, VMware will finally be on its own. Investors should enjoy its parting gift.

summary: Supply problems are inflating the Institute for Supply Management's monthly manufacturing index. Factories are keeping busy-and their supply-chain problems keep getting worse.

Digital Currency Group Inc., a cryptocurrency conglomerate that counts the asset-management firm Grayscale and media company CoinDesk among its holdings, raised $700 million in an investment round, the second-largest in the crypto sector.

title: How a Side Hustle Can Boost Performance at Your Regular Job
summary: A new study shows that moonlighting lifts your mood-and your effectiveness from 9 to 5. Moonlighting may actually help you do better at your day job.

title: Barclays CEO Steps Down Amid Pressure Over Epstein Ties
summary: U.K. lender says regulators had made preliminary conclusions in investigation into relationship. Jes Staley stepped down as chief executive of Barclays PLC under pressure from regulators about how he characterized his relationship with the convicted sex offender and financier Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Public School, Parents' Rights and Civic Peace
summary: Personal, wrenching battles are inevitable when diverse people are forced to fund a single system of schools.. Philip Hamburger's broadside against public schooling ("Is the Public School System Constitutional?" op-ed, Oct. 23) rests on an alleged violation of parental free-speech rights to decide what their children hear. This revisionist view is not what the Founders understood. In 1639 the Mather School in Massachusetts became the first publicly funded elementary school. Thomas Jefferson and John Adams encouraged taxpayer-funded schools. Adams drafted the Massachusetts constitution supporting "public schools." Neither Jefferson nor Adams thought they were violating the free-speech rights of parents.

title: John Mitchell, 'Black-Bag Jobs' and the Watergate Era
summary: It was after Mitchell's intervention that Nixon swiftly rescinded his approval of the Huston Plan.. In his otherwise trenchant op-ed on leadership issues in federal law enforcement ("The FBI Needs a Wray of Courage," Oct. 18), my friend Thomas J. Baker, a distinguished former FBI special agent, mangled the history of the Watergate era with this assertion about the director of the FBI in the first Nixon term: "[J. Edgar] Hoover pushed back against the demands of President Nixon and Attorney General John Mitchell for 'black-bag operations' against political enemies."

title: Basic Due Diligence Turned Up Red Flags at Theranos
summary: A client was impressed by Elizabeth Holmes. A phone call and web search led me in the opposite direction.. Regarding Andy Kessler's column about Theranos ("Failure Is Always an Option," Inside View, Oct. 18): I am a former biotech analyst. Several years ago, the chairman of a client company told me he had seen an interview with Elizabeth Holmes and thought she was terrific and his company would be interested in working with her. He wanted to know what I thought.

title: How to Assess California's Wildfires, Today and in the Past
summary: Many of those pre-1800 fires were set purposefully by California's Native Americans.. In "Climate Activists Blow Smoke in Wildfire Fears" (op-ed, Oct. 28), Bjorn Lomborg writes, "Before 1800, wildfires on average burned between 4.5% and 12% of California each year, far more than the 4.2% of the state consumed by the climate apocalypse in 2020." The historical statistic can be traced to an impressive 2007 scholarly article published in the journal Forest Ecology and Management. That article made clear, however, that many of those pre-1800 fires were set purposefully by California's Native Americans. Other research suggests that Native Americans regularly set such fires to improve travel and hunting conditions. Because such fires were set frequently, they consumed only years of built-up fuel in the forest understory, not the decades of build-up available to modern wildfires.

title: The Government Replaces the Citizen
summary: As volunteers retreat, the state steps in-with its own agenda.. Nancy Cooper's letter "We'll Miss the Ladies Who Volunteered Time" (Oct. 23) asks a great question: "Who's going to take the time or make the effort to do for others?" Progressives don't want you to hear their answer: "The government will do it all, because volunteers cannot be controlled."

title: Novavax Covid-19 Vaccine Gets First Authorization, in Indonesia
summary: Company says it expects more countries will clear the vaccine in coming weeks, though U.S. is likely to take longer because of manufacturing issues. title: The Friend America Needs in Afghanistan
summary: Uzbekistan's newly pragmatic approach to the Taliban is driven by the need for stability.. Now that the U.S. has left Afghanistan, it needs all the help it can get to manage the region. That places Tashkent in a unique position to assist Washington, especially given the dearth of reliable partners.

title: For Privileged Progressives, 'We' Means 'You'
summary: From climate motorcades to maskless public parties, they don't follow the rules they impose on all of us.. title: Quit Burning Tropical Forests and Set Up Carbon Markets
summary: An update on methane and other climate bargains.. Nothing will do more to slow the rate of near-term global warming than cutting an odorless, colorless greenhouse gas-not carbon dioxide but methane. In many cases, reductions are virtually cost-free, and will make it cheaper to deal with the expensive impacts of an unstable climate.

title: Oh Great, Another Cranky Column About Baseball Games Taking Too Long
summary: Still, the point remains. On its biggest stage, the World Series, baseball's got to speed up its action.. Finally, some good news: Reading this lousy sports column will take 3 hours and 57 or so minutes less time than Sunday's Game 5 of the World Series.

title: Is 'Made in the USA' Dead? Not For L.A. Brand Chrome Hearts
summary: Worn by celebrities like Rihanna, Drake and Bella Hadid, the family-owned fashion brand produces nearly all of its products in California-despite the steep costs.. ON A SIDE STREET in New York's West Village on the afternoon of Sept. 11, 30 or so people waited to be let inside a temporary shop the fashion brand Chrome Hearts had mounted for its sub-collection, "Sex Records." Like music fans wearing a band's T-shirt to its concert, many were dressed in Chrome Hearts shirts, hats and hoodies. The line crawled along. One man in Star Trek-esque glasses at the very end said he'd already been waiting 15 minutes. But for these hoarders of the brand, the chance to buy some especially rarefied clothes was well worth the wait.

title: Myanmar Resistance Groups Lure Military Defectors

title: In Maine, Moose Are Being Killed in Effort to Save Them

summary: Resume Subscription. It's a quip that will probably make someone, somewhere mad and make someone else happily tweet it in equal measure. Either way, Nas, in his powder-pink Alexander McQueen look and diamond stud earrings, had the night's biggest trophy in his hand, and he was continuing to hold everyone's attention.
